alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:23PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Washington and southeastern Baker Counties through 900 PM MDT/800 PM PDT/... At 823 PM MDT/723 PM PDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Huntington, or 18 miles northwest of Weiser, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Henley Basin around 840 PM MDT. Sweedes Landing around 800 PM PDT. McChord Butte and southern Brownlee Reservoir around 900 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT/900 PM PDT/ for southwestern Idaho...and southeastern and northeastern Oregon.
